text: José Luis Pineda Aragón (born 19 March 1975) is a retired professional Honduran footballer. ==Club career== Nicknamed el Flaco (the Skinny One), Pineda played the majority of his career for Olimpia, winning a record 9 championship finals.Desafíe a Ismael - La Prensa In summer 2007 he joined Atlético Olanchano,\"Flaco\" Pineda contento en Olancho - La Tribuna then played for Victoria.“El Flaco” se queda - La Prensa He moved to second division Atlético Pinares for the 2012 Clausura.“Siento que he vuelto a nacer” - El Heraldo ===Statistics=== {| class="wikitable" border="1" |- ! width="160" | Team ! width="100" | Season ! width="25" | Games ! width="25" | Start ! width="25" | Sub ! width="25" | Goal ! width="25" | YC ! width="25" | RC |- | width="100" | Victoria | align="center" | 2008-09 A | align="center" | 12 | align="center" | 8 | align="center" | 4 | align="center" | 0 | align="center" | 3 | align="center" | 0 |- |} ==International career== Pineda made his debut for Honduras in a January 1996 CONCACAF Gold Cup match against Canada and has earned a total of 52 caps , scoring 4 goals. He has represented his country in 21 FIFA World Cup qualification matches and played at the 1996CONCACAF Championship, Gold Cup 1996 - Full Details - RSSSF and 2000 CONCACAF Gold Cups.CONCACAF Championship, Gold Cup 2000 - Full Details - RSSSF His final international was an April 2004 friendly match against Panama. ===International goals=== :Scores and results list.
